title: China bans exports of gallium, germanium, antimony to US
content: China has enacted an immediate ban on the export of dual-use items related to gallium, germanium, antimony, and superhard materials to the U.S., in response to Washington's latest crackdown on the Chinese chip sector. The new curbs, citing national security, will require stricter reviews for graphite dual-use exports, escalating trade tensions between the two nations.
summary: China has enacted an immediate ban on the export of dual-use items related to gallium, germanium, antimony, and superhard materials to the U.S., in response to Washington's latest crackdown on the Chinese chip sector. The new curbs, citing national security, will require stricter reviews for graphite dual-use exports, escalating trade tensions between the two nations.

title: 13 women convicted in Cambodia of acting as surrogates for foreign clients
content: Thirteen Filipino women were sentenced to four years in prison for human trafficking-related charges after being found guilty of acting as surrogates in Cambodia. Two years of their sentence were suspended. The women, who are currently in a police hospital, can appeal the verdict. Cambodia banned commercial surrogacy in 2016 due to its growing popularity after restrictions in neighboring countries.
summary: Thirteen Filipino women were sentenced to four years in prison for human trafficking-related charges after being found guilty of acting as surrogates in Cambodia. Two years of their sentence were suspended. The women, who are currently in a police hospital, can appeal the verdict. Cambodia banned commercial surrogacy in 2016 due to its growing popularity after restrictions in neighboring countries.

title: Iran's president criticises new hijab law
content: Iranian President Masoud Pezeshkian has expressed doubts about new legislation imposing tougher penalties on women who flout mandatory hijab regulations. The text has not been officially published, but Iranian media reports say the legislation imposes fines equivalent to up to 20 months' average salary for women who improperly wear a hijab or forgo it altogether in public or on social media.
summary: Iranian President Masoud Pezeshkian has expressed doubts about new legislation imposing tougher penalties on women who flout mandatory hijab regulations. The text has not been officially published, but Iranian media reports say the legislation imposes fines equivalent to up to 20 months' average salary for women who improperly wear a hijab or forgo it altogether in public or on social media.

title: Florida woman sentenced to life for sealing boyfriend in suitcase to die
content: Sarah Boone, 47, received a life sentence for the 2020 suffocation death of her boyfriend, Jorge Torres, in a suitcase. Cellphone videos showed Boone ignoring Torres's pleas for help. Boone claimed they were playing hide-and-seek but was found guilty of second-degree murder after a 10-day trial in Orlando, Florida.
summary: Sarah Boone, 47, received a life sentence for the 2020 suffocation death of her boyfriend, Jorge Torres, in a suitcase. Cellphone videos showed Boone ignoring Torres's pleas for help. Boone claimed they were playing hide-and-seek but was found guilty of second-degree murder after a 10-day trial in Orlando, Florida.

title: Canadian House of Commons faces potential no-confidence vote amid Parliamentary standstill
content: Canadian House of Commons Speaker Greg Fergus schedules opposition days amid Conservative filibuster over unredacted documents. The no-confidence vote against the government may occur as early as next week. Different opposition parties, including the Bloc Québécois and NDP, contemplate their stance on the potential government downfall as the December 10 spending deadline looms.
summary: Canadian House of Commons Speaker Greg Fergus schedules opposition days amid Conservative filibuster over unredacted documents. The no-confidence vote against the government may occur as early as next week. Different opposition parties, including the Bloc Québécois and NDP, contemplate their stance on the potential government downfall as the December 10 spending deadline looms.

title: Hezbollah, Israel exchange fire, testing fragile truce
content: Hezbollah fired towards Israeli-controlled territory, prompting Israeli airstrikes in Lebanon. Both sides accused each other of breaching the cease-fire. The Israeli military targeted numerous sites in Lebanon, resulting in 10 fatalities. The cease-fire, mediated by the US and France, ended over a year of conflict. Israeli leaders emphasized strong retaliation to maintain deterrence and enforce the peace agreement.
summary: Hezbollah fired towards Israeli-controlled territory, prompting Israeli airstrikes in Lebanon. Both sides accused each other of breaching the cease-fire. The Israeli military targeted numerous sites in Lebanon, resulting in 10 fatalities. The cease-fire, mediated by the US and France, ended over a year of conflict. Israeli leaders emphasized strong retaliation to maintain deterrence and enforce the peace agreement.

Elon Musk and Vivek Ramaswamy reveal DOGE's expiry date. When is it?
content: The new Department of Government Efficiency, led by Elon Musk and Vivek Ramaswamy under President-elect Donald Trump, aims to cut wasteful spending and regulations by 2026. Received support includes Bernie Sanders highlighting the Pentagon's budget issues. DOGE plans to disband after achieving its goals.
summary: The new Department of Government Efficiency, led by Elon Musk and Vivek Ramaswamy under President-elect Donald Trump, aims to cut wasteful spending and regulations by 2026. Trump’s defence secretary pick Pete Hegseth faces fresh allegations of alcohol abuse, misconduct: Report
content: Pete Hegseth, Trump's pick for defence secretary, faces allegations of alcohol abuse, sexual misconduct, and mismanagement during his tenure at veterans' nonprofits CVA and VFF. A 2015 whistleblower complaint cites behavior such as intoxication and inappropriate conduct. Hegseth's attorney dismisses the claims as jealous fabrications.
summary: Pete Hegseth, Trump's pick for defence secretary, faces allegations of alcohol abuse, sexual misconduct, and mismanagement during his tenure at veterans' nonprofits CVA and VFF. A 2015 whistleblower complaint cites behavior such as intoxication and inappropriate conduct. Hegseth's attorney dismisses the claims as jealous fabrications.

title: Cinderella effect and manosphere: New York Times cites traditional gender roles for Trump’s victory
content: Donald Trump's victory over Kamala Harris in the 2024 US presidential election is attributed to his appeal to young men frustrated by women surpassing them in education and employment. This shift has driven many men to the 'manosphere,' creating tension and influencing voting behavior.
summary: Donald Trump's victory over Kamala Harris in the 2024 US presidential election is attributed to his appeal to young men frustrated by women surpassing them in education and employment. This shift has driven many men to the 'manosphere,' creating tension and influencing voting behavior.

title: Former Congressional staffer arrested for ammunition possession at the Capitol
content: Michael Hopkins, ex-communications director for Representative Joe Morelle, was arrested for attempting to bring ammunition, including a high-capacity magazine, into the Cannon House Office Building. Following the arrest, Morelle's office terminated Hopkins' employment, underscoring enhanced scrutiny and tightened security protocols at the Capitol.
summary: Michael Hopkins, ex-communications director for Representative Joe Morelle, was arrested for attempting to bring ammunition, including a high-capacity magazine, into the Cannon House Office Building. Following the arrest, Morelle's office terminated Hopkins' employment, underscoring enhanced scrutiny and tightened security protocols at the Capitol.

title: Ex-Kansas detective Roger Golubski dies by suicide ahead of trial for sexual assault
content: Former Kansas detective Roger Golubski, accused of decades-long abuse and civil rights violations against Black women, was found dead at his home. His death, ruled a suicide, occurred just before his trial. Despite the serious allegations and community outrage, his passing leaves many feeling justice was not served.
summary: Former Kansas detective Roger Golubski, accused of decades-long abuse and civil rights violations against Black women, was found dead at his home. His death, ruled a suicide, occurred just before his trial. Despite the serious allegations and community outrage, his passing leaves many feeling justice was not served.

title: US: South Carolina woman pleads guilty in fatal DUI crash that killed bride
content: Jamie Lee Komoroski, a 26-year-old from South Carolina, pleaded guilty to multiple charges in connection with a deadly drunken driving crash that killed a bride and seriously injured the groom just hours after their wedding. The crash occurred in Folly Beach in April 2023. Komoroski faces up to 25 years in prison, with sentencing expected soon.
summary: Jamie Lee Komoroski, a 26-year-old from South Carolina, pleaded guilty to multiple charges in connection with a deadly drunken driving crash that killed a bride and seriously injured the groom just hours after their wedding. The crash occurred in Folly Beach in April 2023. Komoroski faces up to 25 years in prison, with sentencing expected soon.

title: 'All hell to pay': Trump's ultimatum to Hamas to release hostages before 20 Jan
content: President-elect Donald Trump demands the release of hostages held by Hamas in Gaza before his January 2025 inauguration, warning of severe consequences. Over 100 hostages remain in captivity from the October 2023 Hamas attacks. Israeli officials express gratitude, but negotiations remain tense as Hamas links release to an end of Israeli military operations.
summary: President-elect Donald Trump demands the release of hostages held by Hamas in Gaza before his January 2025 inauguration, warning of severe consequences. Over 100 hostages remain in captivity from the October 2023 Hamas attacks. Israeli officials express gratitude, but negotiations remain tense as Hamas links release to an end of Israeli military operations.

title: When drunk Pete Hegseth shouted 'kill all Muslims' at a bar on official tour
content: New Yorker cited a previously undisclosed whistleblower report on Hegseth's tenure as the president of Concerned Veterans for America that said Hegseth was found intoxicated while acting in his official capacity and sometimes he needed to be carried out of the organization's events. In 2015, at a bar, Hegseth drunkenly chanted 'kill all Muslims" during the early hours.
summary: New Yorker cited a previously undisclosed whistleblower report on Hegseth's tenure as the president of Concerned Veterans for America that said Hegseth was found intoxicated while acting in his official capacity and sometimes he needed to be carried out of the organization's events. In 2015, at a bar, Hegseth drunkenly chanted 'kill all Muslims" during the early hours.

title: Jill Biden reacts to Hunter's pardon as President cites 'politicised prosecution'
content: First Lady Jill Biden supports President Joe Biden’s decision to pardon Hunter Biden, convicted of federal gun and tax charges. This pardon, covering offenses from 2014 to 2024, follows claims of selective prosecution. While Hunter acknowledged his mistakes during his addiction, the move faced criticism from Republicans, including Donald Trump, who called it an 'abuse of justice'.
summary: First Lady Jill Biden supports President Joe Biden’s decision to pardon Hunter Biden, convicted of federal gun and tax charges. This pardon, covering offenses from 2014 to 2024, follows claims of selective prosecution. While Hunter acknowledged his mistakes during his addiction, the move faced criticism from Republicans, including Donald Trump, who called it an 'abuse of justice'.

title: Meghan Markle's personal calls rejected by Hollywood power players amid divorce rumors
content: Rhere are rumors of Harry and Meghan growing distant as they have already separated their professional ways. According to experts, their popularity solely rests on the public washing of dirty linens of the royal family. Apart from that, they have no sellable content and if Harry and Meghan professionally go two ways, people won't have much interest in either of their lives.
